metadata.description: Mapping specification for AE domain transformation

variable_mappings.label: Study Identifier
variable_mappings.comments: Required variable. Study identifier from STUDY column (MAXIS-08)

variable_mappings.label: Domain Abbreviation
variable_mappings.comments: Required variable. Domain abbreviation for Adverse Events

variable_mappings.label: Unique Subject Identifier
variable_mappings.comments: Required variable. Unique subject identifier. Need to extract subject ID from source data structure

variable_mappings.label: Sequence Number
variable_mappings.transformation: Use source value if valid, otherwise derive
variable_mappings.comments: Required variable. Sequence number per subject. Source has AESEQ column but should validate sequential ordering

variable_mappings.label: Reported Term for the Adverse Event
variable_mappings.comments: Required variable. Reported term for adverse event as recorded by investigator

variable_mappings.label: Dictionary-Derived Term
variable_mappings.comments: Expected variable. Dictionary-derived term (MedDRA Preferred Term)

variable_mappings.label: Body System or Organ Class
variable_mappings.comments: Expected variable. Body System or Organ Class from MedDRA SOC

variable_mappings.label: Primary System Organ Class
variable_mappings.comments: Permissible variable. Primary System Organ Class

variable_mappings.label: Primary System Organ Class Code
variable_mappings.comments: Permissible variable. Primary System Organ Class Code

variable_mappings.label: Preferred Term Code
variable_mappings.comments: Permissible variable. Preferred Term Code from MedDRA

variable_mappings.label: High Level Term
variable_mappings.comments: Permissible variable. High Level Term from MedDRA

variable_mappings.label: High Level Term Code
variable_mappings.comments: Permissible variable. High Level Term Code

variable_mappings.label: High Level Group Term
variable_mappings.comments: Permissible variable. High Level Group Term (source column appears empty)

variable_mappings.label: High Level Group Term Code
variable_mappings.comments: Permissible variable. High Level Group Term Code

variable_mappings.label: Lowest Level Term
variable_mappings.comments: Permissible variable. Lowest Level Term from MedDRA

variable_mappings.label: Lowest Level Term Code
variable_mappings.comments: Permissible variable. Lowest Level Term Code

variable_mappings.label: Severity/Intensity
variable_mappings.transformation: Map to CDISC controlled terminology: MILD->MILD, MODERATE->MODERATE, SEVERE->SEVERE
variable_mappings.comments: Expected variable. Severity/Intensity. Source already contains MILD/MODERATE/SEVERE values

variable_mappings.label: Serious Event
variable_mappings.comments: Expected variable. Serious Event flag (Yes/No)

variable_mappings.label: Is Life Threatening
variable_mappings.comments: Expected variable. Is event life threatening

variable_mappings.label: Action Taken with Study Treatment
variable_mappings.comments: Expected variable. Action taken with study treatment

variable_mappings.label: Other Action Taken
variable_mappings.comments: Permissible variable. Other action taken (free text description)

variable_mappings.label: Causality
variable_mappings.transformation: Map source values to AEREL codelist: POSSIBLE->POSSIBLE, UNLIKELY->UNLIKELY, UNRELATED->NOT RELATED
variable_mappings.comments: Expected variable. Causality/relationship to study treatment

variable_mappings.label: Causality
variable_mappings.transformation: Map: POSSIBLE->POSSIBLE, UNLIKELY->UNLIKELY, UNRELATED->NOT RELATED, PROBABLE->PROBABLE, RELATED->RELATED
variable_mappings.comments: Alternative causality field (AERELL appears to be the populated field based on sample data)

variable_mappings.label: Outcome of Adverse Event
variable_mappings.comments: Expected variable. Outcome of adverse event

variable_mappings.label: Outcome of Adverse Event
variable_mappings.transformation: Map RESOLVED->RECOVERED/RESOLVED, map to standard OUT codelist
variable_mappings.comments: Alternative outcome field. AEOUTCL appears populated with values like RESOLVED

variable_mappings.label: Start Date/Time of Adverse Event
variable_mappings.transformation: Convert numeric date format to ISO 8601: YYYYMMDD->YYYY-MM-DD, YYYYMM->YYYY-MM, YYYY->YYYY
variable_mappings.comments: Expected variable. Start date of adverse event in ISO 8601 format. Handle partial dates appropriately

variable_mappings.label: Study Day of Start of Adverse Event
variable_mappings.transformation: Calculate study day: AESTDT - Treatment Start Date + 1 (if AESTDT >= TRT Start), else AESTDT - Treatment Start Date
variable_mappings.comments: Permissible variable. Study day of start of adverse event relative to treatment start

variable_mappings.label: End Date/Time of Adverse Event
variable_mappings.transformation: Convert numeric date format to ISO 8601: YYYYMMDD->YYYY-MM-DD, YYYYMM->YYYY-MM, YYYY->YYYY
variable_mappings.comments: Expected variable. End date of adverse event in ISO 8601 format. Handle partial dates and nulls

variable_mappings.label: Study Day of End of Adverse Event
variable_mappings.transformation: Calculate study day: AEENDT - Treatment Start Date + 1 (if AEENDT >= TRT Start), else AEENDT - Treatment Start Date
variable_mappings.comments: Permissible variable. Study day of end of adverse event relative to treatment start

variable_mappings.label: Date/Time of Collection
variable_mappings.comments: Permissible variable. Date/Time of adverse event collection (typically same as start date)

variable_mappings.label: AEDY
variable_mappings.comments: Permissible variable. Study day of adverse event collection

variable_mappings.label: Concomitant or Additional Trtmnt Given
variable_mappings.comments: Permissible variable. Concomitant or Additional Treatment Given

variable_mappings.label: AESITE
variable_mappings.comments: Permissible variable. Investigational site identifier (if AESITE is used for site location)

variable_mappings.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
variable_mappings.comments: Permissible variable. Sponsor-defined identifier (unique event identifier from EDC)

variable_mappings.label: Reported Term for the Adverse Event
variable_mappings.transformation: Use as supplemental source if AEVERB is empty
variable_mappings.comments: Alternative source for reported term if needed

variable_mappings.label: Results in Death
variable_mappings.comments: Expected variable. Results in death flag (derive from serious event criteria if not in source)

variable_mappings.label: Requires or Prolongs Hospitalization
variable_mappings.comments: Expected variable. Requires or prolongs hospitalization (derive from serious event criteria if not in source)

variable_mappings.label: Persist or Signif Disability/Incapacity
variable_mappings.comments: Expected variable. Persist or significant disability/incapacity (derive from serious event criteria)

variable_mappings.label: Congenital Anomaly or Birth Defect
variable_mappings.comments: Expected variable. Congenital anomaly or birth defect (derive from serious event criteria)

variable_mappings.label: Other Medically Important Serious Event
variable_mappings.comments: Expected variable. Other medically important serious event (derive from serious event criteria)

variable_mappings.label: Visit Name
variable_mappings.comments: SDTM Timing variable. Visit name (can be used for supplemental context, not part of core AE domain)

variable_mappings.label: Sequence Number
variable_mappings.transformation: Use as alternative or validation for sequence number if AESEQ is not reliable
variable_mappings.comments: May represent repeat or sequence information from EDC

variable_mappings.label: Pre-Specified Adverse Event
variable_mappings.comments: Permissible variable. Pre-specified adverse event of special interest (if AEANYL indicates analysis flag)

variable_mappings.label: Modified Reported Term
variable_mappings.comments: Permissible variable. Modified reported term (if source contains modified or qualified term)

variable_mappings.label: SUPPAE.QVAL
variable_mappings.comments: Supplemental qualifier - appears to be study-specific question. Map to SUPPAE domain

variable_mappings.label: SUPPAE.QVAL
variable_mappings.comments: Supplemental qualifier - sub-event information. Map to SUPPAE domain

variable_mappings.label: SUPPAE.QVAL
variable_mappings.transformation: Create SUPPAE record with QNAM='CPEVENT' if needed for traceability
variable_mappings.comments: Supplemental qualifier - case report page event type. Map to SUPPAE if needed

variable_mappings.label: SUPPAE.QVAL
variable_mappings.transformation: Create SUPPAE record with QNAM='PT' if represents additional preferred term version
variable_mappings.comments: May represent preferred term version or alternative coding. Sample shows '1-Jan' which may be version date

variable_mappings.label: SUPPAE.QVAL
variable_mappings.transformation: Create SUPPAE record with QNAM='AECOD' if represents alternative coding system
variable_mappings.comments: Alternative or legacy coding field - contains terms similar to AEVERB. Map to SUPPAE if needed for traceability

variable_mappings.label: Adverse Event Occurrence
variable_mappings.comments: Permissible variable. Adverse Event Occurrence flag - always Y in AE domain

variable_mappings.label: Epoch
variable_mappings.comments: SDTM Timing variable. Trial epoch during which AE occurred

derivation_rules.AESEQ: ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY USUBJID ORDER BY AEDTC)
derivation_rules.AESTDY: AESTDTC - RFSTDTC + 1 (if AESTDTC >= RFSTDTC) else AESTDTC - RFSTDTC
derivation_rules.AEENDY: AEENDTC - RFSTDTC + 1 (if AEENDTC >= RFSTDTC) else AEENDTC - RFSTDTC
derivation_rules.AEREL: Use AERELL as primary source if AEREL is not populated or for validation
derivation_rules.AEOUT: Use AEOUTCL as primary source, map to standard terminology
derivation_rules.AETERM: Use as supplemental source if AEVERB is empty
derivation_rules.AESDTH: Derive from AESER and seriousness criteria: if death occurred, set to Y, else N
derivation_rules.AESHOSP: Derive from AESER and seriousness criteria: if hospitalization occurred, set to Y, else N
derivation_rules.AESDISAB: Derive from AESER and seriousness criteria: if disability occurred, set to Y, else N
derivation_rules.AESCONG: Derive from AESER and seriousness criteria: if congenital anomaly, set to Y, else N
derivation_rules.AESMIE: Derive from AESER and seriousness criteria: if other medically important event, set to Y, else N
derivation_rules.AEOCCUR: Set to 'Y' for all records (since these are adverse events that occurred)
derivation_rules.EPOCH: Derive from visit date/treatment dates: map to TREATMENT, FOLLOW-UP, etc. based on timing
